duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct studies to determine engineered labor standards and evaluate the efficient sequence of operations.
Recommend improvements to operational processes to maximize utilization of facilities and personnel.
Implement Labor Management (LM) and engineered labor standards in consumer sites.
Train site management, supervisors, and super-users on usage of LM system.
Perform site audits to ensure compliance with system requirements and evaluate opportunities for improvement.
Work with operations teams to identify improvements in productivity, cost, quality, and customer satisfaction.
Identify potential projects, assess feasibility, and participate in implementing solutions.
Create, maintain, and distribute weekly and monthly project documentation.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma, GED or equivalent education required.
Bachelor’s degree in Operations Management, Logistics, or related field preferred.
One (1) year of time study, industrial engineering, operational analysis, or relevant experience desired.
